story.iWant: to be able to sign up and log in with my Google account
story.soThat: I can have a quick and easy authentication experience
story.tasks: - [ ] **Task 1: Backend API for Google OAuth Callback** (AC: #3, #4) - [ ] Create `GET /api/v1/auth/google` endpoint to initiate Google OAuth flow (redirect to Google). (Source: `tech-spec-epic-1.md#APIs-and-Interfaces`) - [ ] Create `GET /api/v1/auth/google/callback` endpoint to handle the redirect from Google, exchange authorization code for tokens, and manage user creation/login via Supabase Auth. (Source: `tech-spec-epic-1.md#APIs-and-Interfaces`) - [ ] **Task 2: Frontend UI for Google OAuth** (AC: #1, #2, #4) - [ ] Add a "Continue with Google" button to the authentication page. - [ ] Implement client-side logic to redirect to the backend `/api/v1/auth/google` endpoint when the button is clicked. - [ ] Handle successful redirection back to the app, storing session information securely and updating the UI. - [ ] **Task 3: Supabase Configuration** - [ ] Configure Google as an OAuth provider in Supabase. (Source: `tech-spec-epic-1.md#Workflows-and-Sequencing`) - [ ] **Task 4: Testing** - [ ] Add Pytest integration tests for the new backend OAuth endpoints. - [ ] Add a Playwright E2E test to simulate the Google OAuth flow from clicking the button to successful login.

story-context.acceptanceCriteria: 1. **Given** a user is on the login/signup page 2. **When** they click "Continue with Google" 3. **Then** they are redirected to Google's OAuth flow. 4. **And** upon successful authentication, they are redirected back to the app and are logged in.

doc.section: Story 1.3: User Authentication with Google OAuth
doc.snippet: As a User, I want to be able to sign up and log in with my Google account, so that I can have a quick and easy authentication experience.

doc.title: Epic Technical Specification: Core Platform & User Foundation
Decision Architecture
doc.snippet: User authentication will be handled by Supabase Auth, supporting email/password and OAuth providers (Google) as defined in the PRD.

constraints.constraint: User authentication must be handled by Supabase Auth for Google OAuth.
The API must be RESTful and use JSON for requests and responses.
Error handling should follow the defined API contract, using standard HTTP status codes.
The implementation should be added to the existing authentication modules where appropriate.

tests.standards: Backend unit tests should be written with Pytest. Frontend component tests should use React Testing Library. End-to-end tests for user flows should be implemented with Playwright. The Google OAuth flow should be tested using an E2E test that can handle redirects.

locations.location: Component-colocated tests or a central /app/tests/ directory.

ideas.idea: Write an integration test for the `GET /api/v1/auth/google/callback` endpoint.
Write a full E2E test using Playwright that signs up a new user via Google OAuth.
